title: Overhaul of Garage buddy app (in development)
description: Last year I created an app called garage buddy to manage the maintenances of my vehicles. Garage buddy is a SPA that uses Google Firestore for authentication and persistence. The problem is that I want to have more control over the data and to write the domain logic in the backend instead in the SPA. Therefore I created this new project that uses Svelte as frontend, ASP.NET Core in the backend and Entity Framework Core as ORM to a PostgreSQL database. For security in the SPA and backend I rely on Auth0. The API of the backend isn't a REST API, I wanted to try a more CQRS like approach.

title: Focus app
description: During my university studies I sometimes used the pomodoro technique to structure and focus my work. But I didn't like the 'focus, small pause, focus, ...' scheme. For me it's only important to start a session to get the desired focus. The duration is more or less unimportant. Therefore I created a little web app that helps me to get in my focus mode :) Built with svelte ❤️

title: Cashflow
description: In the past I used different budgeting tools. But none met my requirements. Therefore I created a tool to manage my personal finance. Techstack: Svelte, ASP.NET, Auth0, Docker. I stopped this project because of the manual workload to log all expenses. This wasn't practicable. The App MoneyMoney syncs automatically all transactions and let me categorize them.
